# Materials and method

## Data

In this project, the daily record of new hospital admissions grouped by region of residence in Denmark are used. The data is publicly available and were obtained on Statens Serum Institut website^[https://covid19.ssi.dk/overvagningsdata/download-fil-med-overvaagningdata]. In Figure \@ref(fig:admissionsReg)

```{r admissionsReg, echo=FALSE, fig.cap="New hospital admissions grouped by region of residence in Denmark."}
knitr::include_graphics("C:/GIT/state_estimation_C19/reports/figures/newly_admitted_regions.png")
```




## Generalized linear mixed effect model

Consider a hierarchical model for Y specified by

\begin{subequations}
\begin{align}
  Y \sim \mathrm{Pois}(\lambda) \\
  \log(\lambda)=\mathbf{X}\mathbf{\beta}+u
\end{align}
\end{subequations}

where $u \sim\mathrm{N}\big(0,\Sigma(\psi)\big)$.
